title: In Gaza, thousands of sick and wounded risk dying due to lack of medical evacuations
summary: The number of evacuations has fallen drastically since May. The World Health Organization estimates that over 12,000 patients need to be rapidly transferred out of the enclave besieged by Israel.

title: German Christmas market attack: Scholz visits site of deadly attack
summary: With the death toll rising to five people killed and over 200 wounded, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz visited the site, along with Interior Minister Nancy Faeser, who has said the arrested suspect held 'Islamophobic' views.

title: Usyk beats Fury in heavyweight championship rematch
summary: The Ukrainian was awarded the fight 116-112 by all three judges.

title: From the heights of Mount Qasioun, Syrians 'breathe in freedom'
summary: In an area long restricted to the regime's soldiers, the people of Damascus are rediscovering life's simple pleasures.

title: Stellantis reverses plan to lay off 1,100 at Ohio Jeep plant
summary: The decision is following the ouster of embattled chief executive Carlos Tavares.

title: In China, a comedy that dares to be feminist
summary: Released in November, 'Her Story,' directed by Shao Yihui, was a box office success in China. Far from the conservatism advocated by the authorities, the emancipatory aspirations conveyed by its actresses resonate across the country.

title: Mayotte's 'forgotten' residents feel abandoned after Cyclone Chido
summary: A week after Cyclone Chido tore through the northwest of the French overseas territory in the Indian Ocean, the area's devastated towns have still seen no sign of help. As well as anger and feeling abandoned, improvised acts of solidarity are being set up.

title: German Christmas market attack could electrify political debate
summary: On Friday, December 20, a black BMW rammed into pedestrians in Magdeburg, killing two people and injuring dozens more. The driver, a man of Saudi Arabian origin working as a doctor in Germany, has been arrested.

title: How Musk and Trump pushed Congress to the brink of a shutdown
summary: A spending bill to avert a government shutdown passed the House of Representatives and then the Senate on Friday, defying the wishes of the president-elect and the pressure exerted by Tesla's CEO, the new disrupter of American political life.

title: US conducted strikes on Huthi targets in Yemen's capital
summary: The US attack on Sanaa came the same day that a Huthi missile struck Israel's commercial hub Tel Aviv, wounding 16 people in the second such strike in days.

title: Thirteen erotic experiences to give for Christmas
summary: Le Monde offers a selection of gifts for your loved ones eager for new sensations. From learning new practices to subscriptions to ethical pornography platforms, or tickets to parties and butt festivals, here's a selection of naughty fun to put under the tree.

title: France's most powerful nuclear reactor connected to grid after 17-year build
summary: The opening of the European Pressurized Reactor in Flamanville comes 12 years late on the initial schedule.

title: French left calls Macron comments reported by Le Monde 'racist'
summary: The Elysée Palace 'firmly denies' that President Emmanuel Macron said that 'the problem with emergency wards in this country is that they're full of Mamadous.' Le Monde stands by its reporting.

title: Verdict at trial of French teacher's beheading shows continuum between words and murder
summary: In sentencing the two people responsible for the hate campaign against Samuel Paty to 13 and 15 years' imprisonment for terrorism, the court established a new jurisprudence.

title: Five chefs' tips for successful holiday meals
summary: Spicy Christmas poultry, an aperitif with fermented beverages, savory Alsatian shortbread ... our suggestions to brighten up your holiday meal.

title: Berlin-Paris high-speed rail route symbolizes Europe's thirst for train travel
summary: French and German train operators have launched a daily round-trip service between the two European capitals. They're betting that the journey time – eight hours – won't put off customers looking to keep their carbon footprint low.

title: Syrian soldiers on the army's defeat: 'Refusing orders meant the death penalty or worse – imprisonment in Saydnaya'
summary: Soldiers say they were not kept informed by their officers of the rebels' lightning advance. They also reveal a system based on poorly trained conscripts, which could only survive thanks to Iranian and Russian support.

title: Albania to shut down TikTok for a year, says prime minister
summary: 'TikTok is the thug of the neighborhood,' said Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama.

title: In Ukraine, the grueling search for the missing on the battlefield
summary: Before the outbreak of war, the Ukrainians had no centralized data system. Their task is made all the more difficult by having to investigate during the conflict.

title: Sleep coaches for exhausted parents: 'I didn't want to let my baby cry'
summary: The online market for parenting advice is growing. There are a multitude of methods offered for getting your child to sleep, more or less effective and sometimes very costly.
